security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with template files. Contains no executable code with file system, network, or command execution capabilities. Templates are standard p5.js generative art patterns that run entirely in browser context.

content.user_title: Create generative art with seeded randomness
content.value_statement: Generative art creation requires artistic vision and technical skill. This skill helps you create unique, reproducible generative art using p5.js with parameter controls for exploration. You can create flow fields, recursive patterns, particle systems, and more.
actual_capabilities: Creates algorithmic philosophy documents explaining the computational approach
Generates self-contained HTML artifacts using p5.js
Implements seeded randomness for reproducible results
Provides interactive parameter controls for exploration
Enables PNG export of generated art
limitations: Runs in browser context only via generated HTML artifacts
Cannot access local files or external APIs
Depends on p5.js library loaded from CDN

use_cases.title: Create unique generative pieces
use_cases.description: Generate one-of-a-kind algorithmic art with full control over parameters and seeds for reproducibility

use_cases.title: Explore algorithmic aesthetics
use_cases.description: Experiment with flow fields, particle systems, and recursive patterns for creative coding projects

use_cases.title: Demonstrate generative concepts
use_cases.description: Show students how algorithmic processes create visual art with interactive parameter exploration

prompt_templates.title: Simple flow field
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a flow field generative art piece with 5000 particles, subtle noise-based movement, and a warm color palette including orange and earth tones.

prompt_templates.title: Recursive structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate recursive branching structures inspired by natural growth patterns. Use golden ratios, varied line weights, and a cool blue color palette.

prompt_templates.title: Circle patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Create circle packing or Voronoi tessellation generative art. Include adjustable density and relaxation parameters with earth tone colors.

prompt_templates.title: Custom philosophy
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an original generative art piece based on this concept: [describe your concept]. First write an algorithmic philosophy document, then implement it with appropriate parameters.

output_examples.input: Create a particle flow field with organic movement
output: Generates an interactive HTML artifact with 5000 particles following noise-driven flow fields
Particles leave trails creating organic density patterns
Adjustable parameters include particle count, noise scale, flow speed, and trail opacity
Seed navigation allows exploration of different variations
Colors can be customized using palette pickers

best_practices: Use specific seed values to reproduce your favorite variations
Adjust one parameter at a time to understand how each affects the output
Start with conservative parameter values and gradually experiment
anti_patterns: Using excessively high particle counts may slow down the browser
Avoid very high noise scale values which can create chaotic patterns
Do not expect the same output from different seeds - each seed creates unique art

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. The skill generates HTML artifacts that run in any browser.

faq.question: Can I use my own colors?
faq.answer: Yes. The generated art includes color pickers for palette customization. You can adjust colors in real-time.

faq.question: How do I save my favorite variations?
faq.answer: Use the Download PNG button to save the current canvas. For reproducibility, note the seed number.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. All code runs locally in your browser. No data is sent to external servers except loading p5.js from CDN.

faq.question: Why does changing the seed create different art?
faq.answer: The skill uses seeded randomness. The same seed produces identical output. Different seeds create mathematically different but equally valid generative art.

faq.question: How is this different from static image generation?
faq.answer: Generative art creates unique algorithmic outputs that can be explored interactively. Each run with a seed produces reproducible results you can modify and export.
